intro: Jundzillia, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their yellow to golden-colored flowers, which bloom in dense clusters during the summer months. Jundzillia species are typically shrubs with woody stems and narrow, aromatic leaves. They are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
